comments.body: Is `OPENSSL_VERSION` guaranteed to end after `1.1`, or can it be `1.1.0e`? If it's the latter, the `VERSION_EQUAL` comparison will fail.

cmake macro `VERSION_EQUAL` compares only available parts of the version string.
On my system it is something like "1.1.0a"

I tried:
```
cmake --version
cmake version 3.9.0-rc5
```
```
# t.cmake
if("1.1.0.1" VERSION_EQUAL "1.1")
message("Hello")
endif()
```
```
cmake -P t.cmake
```
prints nothing. If I change `"1.1"` to `"1.1.0.1"` then it matches and prints the message.

comments.body: Also in response to Guilherme: civetweb headers are only used by ROOT internally. As long as all those parts (RHTTP and civetweb itself) share the same definition of `OPENSSL_API_1_1` we're good.

Strange, while I see message during compilation:

    -- Use SSL API VERSION 1.1 for civetweb

And value for me is `"1.1.0h"`. But true - value "1.1.0.1" does not work. Have no idea
